f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has the potential to reach a greater audience of potential voters via existing social media outlets.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal anticipates creating a new entity with its own brand.  Will that conflict with existing web properties and outlets?  Targeting of messaging is not addressed.  How do we reach potential voters?  The proposer's experience  does not list expertise at social media.  The budget is high ($50,000) and not broken down.  An issue of fairness may arise - how do we make sure that all proposals get the same amount of exposure?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not list key performance indicators or any other metrics.  I write this assessment through the lens of my 20 years experience as a business analyst and product manager, enthusiastically supporting Cardano for the last three years.  I am not however a developer, so my analysis of highly technical features may be lacking.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is in a way unique. It does not fit the Challenge setting at a macro level, for this challenge is focused on Community Events. There is also no effort to create a community event in this proposal but at a micro level, it does fit for it provides solutions for identified problems in the Challenge settings. Perhaps due to still being unfamiliar with Project Catalyst, the proposer seems to cherry picked the internal problem without taking account the parameters of the Challenge. With that said, recommend the proposer to participate in the Challenge setting that caters to the creation of new Challenge for Fund 8, which will occur around February 2022. Creating a Challenge that solely focus on how to expand Cardano's influence, both between the inner communities and the general public through various marketing tools and techniques. Unfortunately for this current instance, this proposal does not effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Although this does not fit the Challenge, to respect the efforts, assessments will be provided. The relevant experience of the proposer does not fit with the solution the proposer intends to provide. After digging deeper, what this proposer is offering to do is to buy a domain and build content that specifically educates on everything related to voting and then build a social media presence around that premise. This is followed up by buying existing design programs though the correct term currently is to subscribe to a certain program vendor. Then finally hire a professional designer to create high quality social media post. From this, it seems the proposer has not been involved within the community very long. For that, it is recommended for the proposer to please join the Discord channel of Project Catalyst, and to also view the weekly Town Halls of Project Catalyst in the IOHK YouTube Channel and most importantly to attend the After Town Hall's to bounce off their idea with the community there.
f6_assessments.q2: There are some form of roadmaps with adjoining action plans but no clear timeline. This also continues with regards to milestones and KPI's which are also not available. The problem statement is not concise though there is some connection with the solution. The solution itself has potential to be developed into a proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem in the proposal is within this challenge. But there is no detailed plan or key metrics to assess how this event will impact Cardano ecosystem. For this idea, my recommendation about key metrics they can choose is about the number of participates, total value in next fund in ADA, traffic to brand channels...
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no implementation plan and detailed explanations about what the team wants to do. For this project, they should have a plan of event organization online and offline, communication, marketing activities, content preparation... there is a lot of things to do with this type of idea they have to plan and show in the proposal instead of just some briefs. 
Moreover, showing some relevant risks with the detailed implementation plan will be appreciated from CA, vCA because it helps to assess the feasibility better.
Moreover, the basic thing that should have for assessing the proposal is a roadmap. This and the implementation plan info will help to assess the feasibility. And it also helps to assess how reasonable the budget breakdown is. In this proposal, the team explained about the budget but everything nonsense.
f6_assessments.q2:
For helping Catalyst community audit the proposal, the team should give a detailed roadmap with a timeline that is realistic. This proposal doesn't have these things, that's the reason why this proposal cannot be audited. 
One more thing that the team doesn't have here is a detailed explanation about the problem and a solution that to show how they are well-knowing and addressing the problem. Their content is just make us confused about it.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement is logical, clear, and consistent with the challenge summary. The proposal raises concerns that there are many ADA holders but they are not involved in the voting process and they do not understand the proposals.
The solution was to create a social media brand that is not affiliated with IOG/EMURGO/V.V., where catalytic questions and suggestions are discussed in easy-to-understand posts. The solution is possible but there is a lack of explanations on how it will be implemented, what resources are needed or how they will be applied.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is not possible to determine whether the suggestion is likely to succeed because the proposed plan is a bit unclear. While a great idea, not enough information is provided to check the progress of the proposals and their likelihood of success.
The proposal does not adequately represent the knowledge for this development, we do not know the expertise of the team or any information regarding the skills required to do so. Please provide more information and proof of your experience
f6_assessments.q2:
The main weakness of this Proposal is its failure to explain the exact planning or structure of the promised models.
Looking at the proposal, no KPIs were included. Unable to measure because there is no KPI, metric, roadmap or way to measure progress shown in the proposal
In addition, when considering the amount of funds required, there should be a clear detailed explanation of how the funds will be allocated to achieve the mentioned milestones. The proposal to demand $50,000 without any explanation made me question the transparency of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea does address the problem through marketing purposes. I imagine an exciting and readable posts on instagram/TikTok that would even attract new and young individuals to be part of the Cardano ecosystem, by voting for Catalyst or by even being a ADA wallet holders. Though, an in-depth milestones and detail budget allocation are required to drive confidence into this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: As a designer myself, I do believe there is more than meets the eye when creating a social media brand that involves more than one platform. There should be a future planner of some sort to creating impactful content. Just an idea, it will be amazing if the proposer would list down the content plan in a period of time, or a roadmap for this.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget breakdown should be listed fully (ie; how many designers are to be hired for the social media content, hourly expenses. The cost distribution for purchasing hardware and software, Adobe Creative suite have packages, thus, how long will expected milestones to be taken accounted for. The cost for brand domain, and social media accounts, the frequency of actively posting such contents to bring awareness that align with Catalyst discussion). There are no specific roadmap or success metrics provided to see further expansion of the vision given. These factors will be helpful to make this great idea happen!

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about creating a social media brand not affiliated with IOG/Emurgo/etc which discusses catalyst questions and proposals in easily digestible posts. This is an interesting idea.
The problem statement is abstract without explanation and supporting arguments.
The solution is not clear enough and remains very abstract. For instance, the "Preliminary Strategy" is provided, but without a roadmap, KPIs,... and any details for clarifying.
Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 2
f6_assessments.q1:
The team profile, information of demo/pilot, roadmap (and KPIs/metrics) were not described, so it is hard to define how feasible is this plan. Besides, the budget (25% of the challenge fund) is provided with only the total budget. The proposer did not define risk.
Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 2
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided is very limited. There are lacks of: (1) the team profile, (2) information of demo/pilot/similar works; (3) roadmap (and KPIs/metrics); (4) The budget (25% of the challenge fund) is provided with only the total budget (without the structure of items and explanation); (5) Risk and mitigation.
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 1

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is a brilliant idea but what I am missing is matching the problem with the challenge. Providing catalyst snippets to ADA holders wouldn't be enough to get them informed. To me your proposal appears to look like you are sensitizing the community or ADA holders only on some sections of catalyst. In future proposal, it would be great you try to go beyond snippets of catalyst.
However, the goal of the proposal aligns with the challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has got quite some experience for the fact that they are engaged in amateur lobbyist in vector graphic design and explaining technical stuffs. I can't see the breakdown of the budget. I was hoping to see it under the "cost and funding breakdown" heading.
The proposer has not included possible risks/challenges involved in the implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and milestones have been clearly outline but what I can't see is the time horizon for the execution of the proposal. For the purpose of future proposal it would be good you state your time horizon for the proposal achievement.

f6_assessments.q0: The project will be helpful in creating awareness in the cardano community about project catalyst. And as far as adding value to the cardano ecosystem is concern, this is a great idea and will address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan to hire experienced personnel for the project is great because it'll complement the effort of the team lead. Also, creating a social media account on all the social media platform to enlighten and deepen the engagement on project catalyst is an excellent plan, therefore when followed through will be a success. However, the budget for a company and legal expense is not required because cardano.idealscale.com provides an online platform for any engagement on project catalyst. 
Aside that there is no timeline for executing the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The details required in respect of the metric to gauge and track the progress and success of this proposal when funded is not sufficient.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal shows a high understanding of current issues and barriers that exist within the community, especially with regard to non-core members. It addresses this challenge by suggesting a path native to this target group, i.e., social media, instead of the existing (sometimes perceived as overwhelming) channels, such as Discord or Telegram.
f6_assessments.q1: The problem and solution fit well, which is combined with highly relevant and extensive experience, making the successful implementation of this proposal likely. Potential difficulties (such as name scalping), are anticipated.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress and success of the proposal could be more detailed, such as community members reached or converted into higher levels of engagement. Nevertheless, an audit of progress should be possible, and may easily be added. 

The decision of hosting it under an unrelated name, however, needs to be argued better, and discussed with the community today.
